avalancheActivity.comment: Moderate avalanche danger (2nd degree) is declared in the high altitudes of the High Tatras. On northern orientations. Avalanche release is possible on very steep slopes. Caution, on some slopes, especially in the north, there is a weak layer of dangerous faceted snow deeper in the profile. At altitudes below 1600 m a.s.l. the snow was soaked and therefore hardened and stabilised due to the cooling.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Watch out for weak layers on northerly orientations.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 15 cm of new snow gradually fell during the working week. The snowfall was accompanied by very strong southerly winds of gale force. The wind deposited new snow on leeward places, in the gutters of northern orientations and under rock walls. Under the new snow there is a crust of older snow. In places, however, there is also square-grained snow, but this is deeper in profile.

avalancheActivity.comment: Occasionally there is a thin layer of faceted snow in the snow cover. Due to the overall low snow depth and the small number of dangerous places, there is only a low avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanche release is possible only sporadically.

snowpackStructure.comment: In the profile there is occasionally a weak layer of faceted snow.
